'''First Aid Kit''' is a Swedish [[Folk music|folk]] duo consisting of the sisters Johanna and Klara Söderberg, born in 1990 and 1993 respectively.<ref name="bookofriends"/> When performing live, they are accompanied by a drummer, a guitarist and a keyboard player. First Aid Kit started to become internationally known in 2008 with their YouTube uploaded cover of the [[Fleet Foxes]]' song "Tiger Mountain Peasant Song".<ref name="Dolan">{{cite magazine|magazine=Rolling Stone|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-news/the-10-most-killer-cover-songs-of-the-past-decade-97886/|title=The 10 Most Killer Cover Songs of the Past Decade|last=Dolan|first=Jon|date=3 September 2013|access-date=1 February 2022}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.seattleglobalist.com/2012/03/13/stockholm-sisters-tribute-to-fleet-foxes-arrives-in-seattle/1559|title=Stockholm sisters' tribute to Fleet Foxes arrives in Seattle|last=Joko-Fujimoto|first=Claire|date=2012-03-13|website=The Seattle Globalist|access-date=26 May 2016}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/music/2008/dec/10/new-band-first-aid-kit|title=New band of the day – No 447: First Aid Kit|last=Lester|first=Paul|date=10 December 2008|website=the Guardian|access-date=2016-05-26}}</ref> In 2012 ''[[Rolling Stone]]'' magazine had their song "Emmylou" as 10th on their "Single of the Year" list.<ref name="Emmylou_RollingStone">{{cite web|title=Rolling Stone Music: 50 Best Songs of 2012: First Aid Kit, 'Emmylou'|date=5 December 2012 |url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/lists/50-best-songs-of-2012-20121205/first-aid-kit-emmylou-19691231|publisher=Rollingstone.com|access-date=6 March 2014}}</ref> First Aid Kit has released five albums, four EPs and several singles. In [[Brit Awards 2015|2015]], they were nominated for a [[Brit Awards|Brit Award]] as one of the five [[Brit Award for International Group|best international groups]].<ref name="Brit2015">{{cite web |url=http://www.brits.co.uk/winners/ |title=The Brit Awards winners 2015 (archived) |date=25 February 2015 |access-date=22 September 2017 |url-status=bot: unknown |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150227214946/http://www.brits.co.uk/winners/ |archive-date=27 February 2015}}</ref> They were nominated again in [[Brit Awards 2019|2019]] and [[Brit Awards 2023|2023]].<ref name="Brit2019">{{cite web|url=https://www.brits.co.uk/nominees|title=Brit Awards 2019 Vote for your favourite|work=brits.co.uk|access-date=12 January 2019|archive-date=11 January 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200111194725/https://www.brits.co.uk/nominees|url-status=dead}}</ref><ref name="Brit2023">{{cite web|url = https://www.brits.co.uk/news/2023-international-group-of-the-year-nominees-announced|title= 2023 International Group of the Year nominees announced |work=brits.co.uk|access-date=12 January 2023}}</ref>

==Early history==
Sisters Johanna (born 31 October 1990) and Klara (born 8 January 1993) Söderberg are from [[Enskede-Årsta-Vantör|Enskede]], in [[Stockholm]].<ref name="bookofriends">{{cite web|title=Book of friends, Swedish Radio P3, 9 July 2013 |url=http://static-cdn.sr.se/sida/images/3849/2909375_1200_674.jpg |publisher=Sverigesradio.se |access-date=22 September 2017}}</ref> Their father Benkt Söderberg was a member of the Swedish rock pop band [[Lolita Pop]],<ref name="SommarP1">{{cite web|url=http://sverigesradio.se/sida/artikel.aspx?programid=2071&artikel=5127784|title=Klara och Johanna Söderberg - Sommar & Vinter i P1, 8 July 2012|publisher=Sveriges Radio|date=2012-07-08|access-date=2015-04-05}}</ref>{{rp|at=3:20–4:03}} but quit before Johanna was born and became a teacher of history and religion.<ref name="Radar" /> Their mother teaches cinematography.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/culture/music/rockandpopfeatures/9678475/First-Aid-Kit-interview-musical-pain-relief.html|title=First Aid Kit interview: musical pain relief|date=20 November 2012|publisher=telegraph.co.uk|access-date=6 December 2017}}</ref>

From childhood, Klara and Johanna were eager singers, giving concerts using a [[jump rope]] as a pretend microphone.<ref name="SommarP1" />{{rp|at=0:40–2:40}} Klara's favorite songs were [[Judy Garland]]'s songs from ''[[The Wizard of Oz (1939 film)|The Wizard of Oz]]'' and [[Billie Holiday]]'s version of "[[Gloomy Sunday]]", which she sang without much understanding of the English lyrics.<ref name="Sonic2011">{{cite web|url = http://sonicmagazine.com/2018/03/25/tvarsemot-tiden/|title= Tvärsemot tiden (originally published in Sonic #60 in December 2011)|date=March 25, 2015|publisher=sonicmagazine.com|access-date=February 1, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160306053316/http://www.sonicmagazine.com/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=4788&Itemid=117&mosmsg=Item+saved+successfully |archive-date=6 March 2016}}</ref> Klara wrote her first song, "Femton mil i min Barbiebil" [Fifteen [[Scandinavian mile|Scandinavian miles]] in my Barbie car], when she was six.<ref name="gulliga">{{cite web|url = http://www.svd.se/first-aid-kit-vill-inte-vara-gulliga_1143199|title= First Aid Kit vill inte vara gulliga|date=17 April 2008|publisher=svd.se|access-date=6 December 2017 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150723131112/http://www.svd.se/first-aid-kit-vill-inte-vara-gulliga_1143199|archive-date=23 July 2015}}</ref>

Klara and Johanna both attended the [[Internationella Engelska Skolan]] ( International English School ) of Enskede.<ref name="School">{{cite news|title=First Aid Kit tillbaka där allt började, 27 March 2012|newspaper=Dagens Nyheter |date=27 March 2012 |url=http://www.dn.se/kultur-noje/musik/first-aid-kit-tillbaka-dar-allt-borjade/|publisher=dn.se|access-date=12 April 2015}}</ref> Klara applied for admission to [[Adolf Fredrik's Music School]], but was not accepted.<ref>{{cite web|url = http://www.dn.se/kultur-noje/musik/succesystrarna-fran-svedmyra/|title=Succésystrarna från Svedmyradate=19 January 2010|publisher=dn.se|access-date=7 December 2017 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160412162900/http://www.dn.se/kultur-noje/musik/succesystrarna-fran-svedmyra/|archive-date=12 April 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Klara Söderberg: "Jag kom inte in på musikskolan", 14 October 2014|url=http://www.svt.se/skavlan/first-aid-kit-och-lena-endre-i-skavlan/|publisher=Sveriges Television|access-date=12 April 2015}}</ref>

In 2005, when Klara was 12, a friend introduced her to the band [[Bright Eyes (band)|Bright Eyes]].<ref name="Sonic2011" /> This led her to country and folk music stars such as [[Johnny Cash]], [[Bob Dylan]], [[Leonard Cohen]], the [[Carter Family]], [[Louvin Brothers]], [[Townes Van Zandt]], [[Gram Parsons]] and [[Emmylou Harris]]. The same year, she received a guitar as a Christmas present<ref name="Radar">{{cite web|title=Interview in Under The Radar, 18 October 2010|url=http://www.undertheradarmag.com/interviews/first_aid_kit/|publisher=Undertheradarmag.com|access-date=13 May 2014}}</ref> and quickly learned to play it.

Johanna enjoyed a wide range of music, from [[Britney Spears]] to [[Techno|German techno]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Interview in It's Nice That, 16 April 2015|url=http://www.itsnicethat.com/articles/first-aid-kit|publisher=itsnicethat.com|access-date=19 April 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Interview in Mashable, 16 October 2014|date=16 October 2014 |url=http://mashable.com/2014/10/16/first-aid-kit-band/|publisher=Mashable.com|access-date=23 October 2014}}</ref> When she saw the film ''[[O Brother, Where Art Thou?]]'' and listened to its soundtrack, she was inspired to sing "[[Down in the River to Pray]]" with Klara. Fascinated by the result, the two began to sing together, first at home and then as street singers in the [[Stockholm metro]] and in front of liquor stores.<ref name="SommarP1" />{{rp|at=16:10–17:55}}<ref name="WorldCafe2015">{{cite web|url=https://www.npr.org/sections/world-cafe/2015/07/31/428150148/world-cafe-sense-of-place-stockholm-first-aid-kit|title=Interview (audio): World Cafe Sense Of Place — Stockholm: First Aid Kit, 31 July 2015|publisher=WXPN & npr.org|access-date=2015-08-02}}</ref>{{rp|at=2:55-4:35}} Klara chose the name for their band at age 13 by looking through a dictionary. She found the term "first aid kit" and thought it best described what she wanted her music to be.<ref name="Radar" />

Klara and Johanna began to write their own country-folk songs inspired by [[Devendra Banhart]] and [[CocoRosie]], among others,<ref name="Sonic2011" /> without much influence from their parents, who were fonder of [[Patti Smith]], [[Velvet Underground]] and the [[Pixies (band)|Pixies]].<ref name="Radar" /> Their father has said that he was astonished and a little jealous of the ease his daughters had in producing their music.<ref>{{cite web|title=Så är det att ha en popstjärna som barn, 21 March 2011|url=http://sverigesradio.se/sida/artikel.aspx?programid=4067&artikel=4413437|access-date=4 April 2015}}</ref>{{rp|at=8:20–8:55}} The most important advice their father gave them was to sing so loud that even somebody behind a wall could hear it.<ref name="Sonic2011" />

==Career==

===2007–2009: Beginnings and ''Drunken Trees'' EP===
In April 2007, the sisters began to upload their self-made songs to the social networking site [[MySpace]].<ref name="gulliga" /> They also sent a demo of their song "Tangerine" to  Swedish radio.<ref>{{cite web|title=First Aid Kit at Wichita website in 2009 (archived) |url=http://www.wichita-recordings.com/index.php/artists/detail/first_aid_kit/ |access-date=21 September 2014 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090118014829/http://www.wichita-recordings.com/index.php/artists/detail/first_aid_kit/ |archive-date=January 18, 2009 }}</ref> It immediately went on air and was listed as one of the best songs of the summer 2007,<ref>{{cite web|title=Bäst juli 2007 (archived)|url=http://sverigesradio.se/sida/artikel.aspx?programid=2945&artikel=1473208|publisher=sverigesradio.se|access-date=19 April 2015 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160304000935/http://sverigesradio.se/sida/artikel.aspx?programid=2945&artikel=1473208 |archive-date=4 March 2016}}</ref> which led to requests for live performances and even some offers from record companies. The first official performance as First Aid Kit was at PUNKTmedis library in Stockholm on 6 October.<ref name="School" /><ref>{{cite web|title=Stor publik på PUNKTdemo 6 oktober|url=http://punktmedis.blogspot.fi/2007/10/|publisher=PUNKTmedis|access-date=4 September 2017}}</ref> More performances followed, but as Klara was 14 and still at school, they could only play during weekends.

Coincidentally, their younger brother attended the same kindergarten as the daughter of [[Karin Dreijer]], half of Swedish electronic duo [[The Knife]], also known as [[Fever Ray]].<ref name="gulliga" /> Their mother asked Dreijer to check out her daughters' songs on MySpace.<ref name="Sonic2011" /> The band subsequently signed with [[Rabid Records]], a label co-owned by The Knife, with conditions that allowed the duo to have full control over their music and album art.<ref name="Radar" />

In April 2008, the band released their debut EP ''[[Drunken Trees]]'' in Sweden, and made their first appearance on Swedish TV.<ref name="gulliga" /><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rabidrecords.com:80/firstaidkit/default.html|title=First Aid Kit|publisher=rabidrecords.com|access-date=7 December 2017|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080328230710/http://www.rabidrecords.com/firstaidkit/default.html|archive-date=28 March 2008}}</ref> The EP was produced by their father, and was a re-recorded collection of songs from their MySpace, originally entitled "Cross Oceans".

The duo was relatively well known in Sweden by August 2008, when they uploaded a cover version of "Tiger Mountain Peasant Song" by [[Fleet Foxes]] to YouTube. [[Robin Pecknold]], frontman and lead guitarist for Fleet Foxes, praised the cover on his band's webpage, causing a surge in popularity for the video.<ref name="Radar" /><ref name="SommarP1" />{{rp|at=32:40-34:30}} This exposure led to international recognition, and by the end of 2008, the duo had signed a record deal with [[Wichita Records]].

[[File:First Aid Kit Wiesbaden 2009 double.jpg|thumb|right|Johanna (left) and Klara Söderberg in [[Wiesbaden]] in 2009]]
Due to international touring, Johanna quit high school in the autumn of 2008 (and Klara never started).<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DtE9P57vBAA  |archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/varchive/youtube/20211215/DtE9P57vBAA |archive-date=2021-12-15 |url-status=live|title=LADYGUNN TV / First Aid Kit Interview |date=20 April 2014 |publisher=YouTube |access-date=2014-06-06}}{{cbignore}}</ref> Their father took a leave from his job as a teacher and accompanied them on tour. First Aid Kit's first show outside [[Scandinavia]] took place on 22 November 2008 at the [[Crossing Border Festival]] in Netherlands. Fleet Foxes performed the day before, and when Pecknold spotted the duo standing at the edge of the stage, they were spontaneously asked to join to sing "Tiger Mountain Peasant Song".<ref name="SommarP1" />{{rp|at=34:30–35:10}}<ref name="WorldCafe2015" />{{rp|at=6:15–7:35}}

Wichita re-released ''Drunken Trees'' on 23 February 2009 as an enhanced EP, with "Tiger Mountain Peasant Song" added as a bonus track, along with several videos.

===2010–2011: ''The Big Black and the Blue''===
The duo released their first album, ''[[The Big Black and the Blue]]'' on 1 February 2010.<ref>{{cite web |title=The Big Black And The Blue (Limited Edition CD) |url=http://www.wichita-recordings.com:80/shop/music/the-big-black-and-the-blue-2.html |access-date=6 December 2017 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100410162919/http://www.wichita-recordings.com/shop/music/the-big-black-and-the-blue-2.html |archive-date=10 April 2010}}</ref> As with the ''Drunken Trees'' EP, the album was again produced by their father. The release was followed by an extensive tour throughout the United States, Canada, Australia, New Zealand and parts of Europe, including [[Primavera Sound Festival]] in [[Barcelona]].<ref>{{cite web|title=First Aid Kit redo för stora genomslaget|date=28 December 2011 |url=http://www.helagotland.se/noje/first-aid-kit-redo-for-stora-genomslaget-7370083.aspx|publisher=Helagotland.se|access-date=6 December 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=First Aid Kit ready to save America this fall|date=25 July 2010 |url=https://consequence.net/2010/07/first-aid-kit-ready-to-save-america-this-fall/|publisher=Consequence|access-date=1 February 2022}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=First Aid Kit Sunday 05 September - Saturday 11 September 2010|url=http://www.pennydrop.com.au/tour/first-aid-kit-5/|publisher=pennydrop.com.au|access-date=6 December 2017|archive-date=6 December 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171206204224/http://www.pennydrop.com.au/tour/first-aid-kit-5/|url-status=dead}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=First Aid Kit September 16, 2010 The Wine Cellar, Auckland|url=http://www.einsteinmusicjournal.co.nz/first-aid-kit-live-photos/|publisher=einsteinmusicjournal.co.nz|access-date=6 December 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=San Miguel Primavera Sound 2010 Tickets|url=http://www.primaverasound.es/noticiaSingle?id=238/|publisher=primaverasound.es|access-date=6 December 2017}}</ref>

On 19 November 2009, Klara and Johanna met [[Conor Oberst]] after [[Monsters of Folk]]'s concert in Stockholm, and gave him a demo of their coming album.<ref>{{cite web|title="Vi är inblandade i allt tillsammans", 28 December 2011|date=28 December 2011 |url=https://www.expressen.se/noje/vi-ar-inblandade-i-allt-tillsammans/|publisher=expressen.se|access-date=6 December 2017}}</ref> Oberst watched the duo perform at the [[Austin City Limits Music Festival]] pre-party in Texas on 7 October 2010. At this concert, he was especially impressed by the duo's acoustic performance of Ghost Town, which the audience listened to in rapt silence. After meeting the duo, Oberst called [[Mike Mogis]] and asked him to see the duo's performance at the ACL Festival two days later, on October 9.<ref name="Sonic2011" /> After watching this performance, Mogis offered to produce the duo's next album.<ref name="SommarP1" />{{rp|at=29:20–31:20}}<ref>{{cite web|url = http://www.svd.se/allt-stammer-for-first-aid-kit|title=Allt stammer för First Aid Kit|date=27 January 2012|publisher=svd.se|access-date=7 December 2017 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160312104906/http://www.svd.se/allt-stammer-for-first-aid-kit|archive-date=12 March 2016}}</ref>

Two days later, on 11 October 2010, after playing a concert in [[Nashville]], the duo received a telephone call from [[Jack White (musician)|Jack White]], who asked the duo to visit his studio the next day.<ref name="Sonic2011" /> The result was a vinyl single containing cover versions of [[Buffy Sainte-Marie]]'s "[[Universal Soldier (song)|Universal Soldier]]" and [[Mel London]]'s and [[Tampa Red]]'s "[[It Hurts Me Too]]". The single was released on White's [[Third Man Records]] label.<ref name="SommarP1" />{{rp|at=35:30–36:55}}<ref>{{cite web|title=14 May 2014 First Aid Kit at Jo Whiley BBC Radio 2, (at 2:30 of the interview)|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/p01z4wq7/|publisher=Bbc.co.uk|access-date=25 May 2014}}</ref>

First Aid Kit performed at the [[Polar Music Prize]] gala on 30 August 2011 in Stockholm, where they performed the song "[[Dancing Barefoot]]" for the winner [[Patti Smith]]. Smith was moved to tears at the intense ending of the song.<ref name="SommarP1" />{{rp|at=4:03–6:40}}

Johanna, under the moniker ''MoA'', released song covers of K-Pop artists such as [[2NE1]] and [[4Minute]]<ref>{{Cite web |date=2022-07-20 |title=The Swedish Composer Behind HyunA's New Single "Nabillera" Actually Has A Surprising (Now Deleted) History With The K-Pop World |url=https://www.koreaboo.com/stories/composer-hyuna-new-nabillera-surprising-kpop-world/ |access-date=2023-02-22 |website=Koreaboo |language=en-US}}</ref> during 2010 to 2011. The covers were deleted after her identity was inadvertently revealed.

===2012–2013: ''The Lion's Roar''===
[[File:First Aid Kit (Frankfurt am Main, 18.02.2012).jpg|thumb|left|First Aid Kit (Frankfurt am Main, 18 February 2012)]]
In January 2012, the band released their second album, ''[[The Lion's Roar (album)|The Lion's Roar]]'', produced by [[Mike Mogis]]. The album was critically acclaimed, debuting at number one in Sweden and number 35 in the UK. The duo toured extensively in support of the album, including performances at several major festivals.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/2517105/lollapalooza-2012-friday/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171206203450/http://www.mtv.com/news/2517105/lollapalooza-2012-friday/|url-status=dead|archive-date=6 December 2017|title=First Aid Kit talks festival essentials and more at Lollapalooza 2012|date=4 August 2012|publisher=mtv.com|access-date=6 December 2017}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://diymag.com/archive/bestival-2012-first-aid-kit|title=Bestival 2012: First Aid Kit|date=12 September 2012|publisher=diymag.com|access-date=6 December 2017}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.clashmusic.com/live/berlin-festival-2012|title=Berlin Festival 2012|date=19 September 2012|publisher=clashmusic.com|access-date=6 December 2017}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.austinchronicle.com/music/2012-10-19/acl-live-shot-first-aid-kit/|title=ACL Live Shot: First Aid Kit|date=19 October 2012|publisher=austinchronicle.com|access-date=6 December 2017}}</ref> The duo performed the song "Emmylou" on ''[[Conan (talk show)|Conan]]'' in April 2012,<ref>{{Cite web|date=17 April 2012|title=Watch First Aid Kit Play "Emmylou" On Conan|url=https://www.pastemagazine.com/articles/2012/04/watch-first-aid-kit-play-emmylou-on-conan.html|access-date=6 December 2017|publisher=pastemagazine.com|archive-date=6 December 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171206213953/https://www.pastemagazine.com/articles/2012/04/watch-first-aid-kit-play-emmylou-on-conan.html|url-status=dead}}</ref> and on [[Late Show with David Letterman|''The Late Show with David Letterman'']] in October 2012.<ref>{{cite web|title=IMDb|url=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt3323384/|access-date=18 January 2014|publisher=IMDb.com}}</ref> 

On 28 August 2012, they performed "[[America (Simon & Garfunkel song)|America]]" for the Polar Music Prize winner [[Paul Simon]], who gave the duo a standing ovation.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://time.com/3591929/first-aid-kit-america-video/|title=Watch First Aid Kit Travel the Country in 'America' Video|date=18 November 2014|publisher=time.com|access-date=6 December 2017}}</ref>

[[File:First Aid Kit på Grammisgalan 2013.jpg|thumb|upright=.8|Johanna and Klara Söderberg at the [[Grammis|Swedish Grammis Awards]] in 2013]]

The song "The Lion's Roar" was featured in episode 2 of series 4 of ''[[Misfits (TV series)|Misfits]]'',<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.misfitsmusic.co.uk/php/season4/misfits_season4_episode_2.php|title=Misfits Series 4: Episode 2 Playlist|publisher=misfitsmusic.co.uk|access-date=6 December 2017|archive-date=1 December 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171201114455/http://www.misfitsmusic.co.uk/php/season4/misfits_season4_episode_2.php|url-status=dead}}</ref> and in the opening sequence of the video game "[[The Long Dark]]". "In the Hearts of Men" was featured in episode 21 of season 8 of ''[[Bones (TV series)|Bones]]''.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.tunefind.com/show/bones/season-8/14102|title=Bones S8, E21 The Maiden in the Mushrooms|publisher=tunefind.com|access-date=6 December 2017}}</ref> The song "I Found a Way" appeared in the second episode of the [[Dontnod Entertainment]]'s 2019 video game ''[[Life Is Strange 2]]'' in 2019.

In November 2012, the duo received awards for "Composer of the year" and "Breakthrough of the Year" from the Swedish Music Publishers Association.<ref>{{cite web|title=Musikförläggarnas pris - Resultat & bilder 2012|url=http://musikforlaggarna.se/musikforlaggarnas-pris/resultat-bilder/?yearly=2012|publisher=Musikförläggarna|access-date=12 November 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141218025532/http://musikforlaggarna.se/musikforlaggarnas-pris/resultat-bilder/?yearly=2012|archive-date=18 December 2014|url-status=dead}}</ref> The song "Emmylou" was listed at 10th position by ''[[Rolling Stone]]'' magazine in their "Single of the Year" list of 2012.<ref name="Emmylou_RollingStone"/> In February 2013, First Aid Kit was awarded the [[Nordic Music Prize]] for Best Nordic 2012 Album.<ref>{{cite web|title=First Aid Kit wins the third annual Nordic Music Prize! (archived) |url=http://nordicmusicprize.com/ |publisher=Nordicmusicprize.com |access-date=12 May 2015 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140518112144/http://nordicmusicprize.com/ |archive-date=18 May 2014 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Søstrene vant nordisk albumpris|url=http://www.aftenposten.no/incoming/Sostrene-vant-nordisk-albumpris-7121987.html|publisher=Aftenposten.no|access-date=15 February 2013}}</ref> They were also awarded four Swedish [[Grammis]] awards for 2012 "Artist of the Year", "Songwriter of the Year", "Best Pop of the Year" and "Album of the Year".<ref>{{cite web|title=First Aid Kit Win 4 Grammis! |url=http://www.wichita-recordings.com/news/first-aid-kit-win-4-grammis |access-date=4 April 2015 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140201133837/http://www.wichita-recordings.com/news/first-aid-kit-win-4-grammis |archive-date=1 February 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Grammisvinnarna genom åren|url=http://grammis.se/om-grammis/grammisvinnarna-genom-aren/|publisher=Grammis.se|access-date=22 September 2017}}</ref>

===2014–2016: ''Stay Gold''===
[[File:First Aid Kit - Ruisrock 2014-07-06.jpg|thumb|left|First Aid Kit at [[Ruisrock]] 6 July 2014]]

Their third studio album, ''[[Stay Gold (First Aid Kit album)|Stay Gold]]'', was released on 10 June 2014 through [[Columbia Records]].<ref>{{cite tweet|user=ColumbiaRecords|author=Columbia Records|number=450643939285286912|date=31 March 2014|title=.@FirstAidKitBand's "Stay Gold" hits stores June 10th. Pre-order now & get an instant download of "My Silver Lining"}}</ref> The band released two singles from the album: "[[My Silver Lining (First Aid Kit song)|My Silver Lining]]" and "Cedar Lane".<ref>{{cite web|title=My Silver Lining Single|url=http://www.indieshuffle.com/first-aid-kit-my-silver-lining/|publisher=Indieshuffle.com|access-date=31 March 2014}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.scandipop.co.uk/first-aid-kit-cedar-lane/|title=First Aid Kit: 'Cedar Lane'|date=6 May 2014|publisher=scandipop.co.uk|access-date=6 December 2017}}</ref> As a result, the duo again received the "Composer of the year" prize from the Swedish Music Publishers Association.<ref>{{cite web|title=Musikförläggarnas pris - Resultat & bilder 2014|url=http://musikforlaggarna.se/musikforlaggarnas-pris/resultat-bilder/?yearly=2014|publisher=Musikförläggarna|access-date=12 April 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160311085652/http://musikforlaggarna.se/musikforlaggarnas-pris/resultat-bilder/?yearly=2014|archive-date=11 March 2016|url-status=dead}}</ref> In January 2015, First Aid Kit was nominated for the [[2015 Brit Awards]] in the Best International Group category as one of five nominees,<ref name="Brit2015" /> and won the "Best group of the year" prize in the [[Sveriges Radio P3|Swedish Radio P3]] Gold Gala.<ref>{{cite web|url = http://sverigesradio.se/sida/gruppsida.aspx?programid=3964&grupp=21828&artikel=6070322/|title= Årets grupp: First Aid Kit|date=17 January 2015|language=sv|access-date=18 January 2015}}</ref> In the same month, the band was featured on a Swedish postage stamp.<ref>{{cite web|title=Swedish pop exports on postage stamps|url=http://www.postnord.com/en/media/press-releases/postnord/2014/swedish-pop-exports-avicii-and-robyn-on-postage-stamps/|publisher=Postnord|access-date=9 November 2014|archive-date=8 November 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141108214122/http://www.postnord.com/en/media/press-releases/postnord/2014/swedish-pop-exports-avicii-and-robyn-on-postage-stamps|url-status=dead}}</ref> The album ''Stay Gold'' was listed at number 6 in the [[Paste (magazine)|Paste magazine]]'s 40 best folk albums of the 2010s list.<ref>{{cite web|date=22 November 2019|title=The 40 Best Folk Albums of the 2010s|url=https://www.pastemagazine.com/articles/2019/11/best-folk-albums-of-the-2010s.html|access-date=24 November 2019|work=pastemagazine.com}}</ref>

===2017: Singles and resumed touring===
At the beginning of 2017 Klara and Johanna were at [[Flora Recording & Playback]] in Portland, Oregon, finishing their fourth album.

In early 2017, First Aid Kit provided backing vocals for Jesper Lindell's ''A Little Less Blue'' EP, which was produced by Sten Booberg and the duo's father, Benkt Söderberg.<ref>{{cite web|url = http://bloggar.aftonbladet.se/musikbloggen/2017/02/first-aid-kit-jesper-lindell-moving-slow/|title= First Aid Kit om Jesper Lindell: 'Önskar vi skrivit låten!'|date= 10 February 2017|publisher=Aftonbladet|access-date=21 February 2017}}</ref> The EP was released on 21 April 2017.<ref name="A Little Less Blue">{{cite web|url = https://www.mynewsdesk.com/se/bmg-scandinavia/pressreleases/first-aid-kit-gaestar-paa-jesper-lindells-efterlaengtade-debut-ep-1881544|title= First Aid Kit gästar på Jesper Lindells efterlängtade debut-EP!|date= 28 March 2017|publisher=BMG Scandinavia|access-date=4 April 2017}}</ref>

[[File:First Aid Kit - Leonard Cohen tribute Concert - Dramaten Stockholm March 13 2017.jpg|thumb|First Aid Kit at their Leonard Cohen tribute concert in Dramaten, Stockholm, Sweden 13 March 2017]]

On 10 March, First Aid Kit released a new single, "You Are the Problem Here", for [[International Woman's Day]]. The band called the song an angry song, inspired by yet another story of a man getting off easy after raping a woman. The track was produced and mixed by Tucker Martine from [[Flora Recording & Playback]] studio.<ref>{{cite web|url = http://www.out.com/music/2017/3/08/first-aid-kits-you-are-problem-here-rips-apart-rape-apologists|title= First Aid Kit's 'You Are the Problem Here' Rips Apart Rape Apologists|date= 8 March 2017|publisher=Out Magazine|access-date=11 March 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url = https://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/hear-first-aid-kits-vengeful-new-song-you-are-the-problem-here-w471010|title= Hear First Aid Kit's 'Vengeful' New Song 'You Are the Problem Here'|date= 8 March 2017|publisher=Rolling Stone|access-date=11 March 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url = https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=exsaCN4c5dc|title= First Aid Kit - You Are The Problem Here (Lyric Video)|date= 11 March 2017|publisher=Jagadambarecords|access-date=11 March 2017}}</ref> A 7-inch vinyl copy of "You Are the Problem Here" was released on [[Record Store Day]] 2018. All profits from the song are donated to [[Women for Women International]].<ref>{{cite web|url = https://recordstoreday.com/SpecialRelease/10155|title= First Aid Kit - You are the problem here|work=recordstoreday.com|access-date=22 April 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url = http://www.longlivevinyl.net/first-aid-kit-to-release-you-are-the-problem-here-7-for-record-store-day/|title= First Aid Kit to release You Are The Problem Here 7" for Record Store Day|work=longlivevinyl.net|date= 8 March 2018|access-date=22 April 2018}}</ref>

First Aid Kit held four [[Leonard Cohen]]-themed concerts in Spring 2017 with their friends in [[Royal Dramatic Theatre|Dramaten]], Stockholm, Sweden.<ref>{{cite web|url = http://bloggar.aftonbladet.se/musikbloggen/2017/03/first-aid-kit-gor-suveran-cohen-hyllning/|title= First Aid Kit gör suverän Cohen-hyllning|date= 14 March 2017|publisher=Aftonbladet|access-date=15 March 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url = http://www.dramaten.se/repertoar/First-aid-kit-leonard-cohen/|title= First Aid Kit och vänner: en hyllning till Leonard Cohen|publisher=Dramaten|access-date=27 April 2017}}</ref> Their concert on 13 March was filmed by [[Sveriges Television]], and broadcast on 14 and 15 October by SVT2.<ref>{{cite web|url = http://vipatv.svt.se/204/kronikor/arkiv-for-kronikor/2017-03-17-alla-i-sverige-far-hora-first-aid-kit---tack-vare-svt.html|title= Alla i Sverige får höra First Aid Kit - tack vare SVT|publisher=SVT|access-date=18 March 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url = https://www.svtplay.se/first-aid-kit-tolkar-cohen-pa-dramaten|title= First Aid Kit tolkar Cohen på Dramaten|publisher=SVT|access-date=15 October 2017}}</ref> An audio recording of the concert was released on 26 March 2021.<ref name="WhoByFire_NME">{{cite web|url = https://www.nme.com/en_asia/news/music/first-aid-kit-announce-live-leonard-cohen-tribute-album-share-version-of-suzanne-2890697 |title= First Aid Kit announce live Leonard Cohen tribute album, share version of 'Suzanne' |publisher=NME|date=27 February 2021|access-date=2 March 2021}}</ref>

On Record Store Day 2017, [[Third Man Records]] published the book ''The Blue Series: The Story Behind the Color'', which contains a story by Johanna and Klara about recording songs in [[Jack White]]'s studio, and a 7-inch split blue vinyl single with the band's previously unreleased cover of "[[Gloomy Sunday]]". The record store day issue was limited to 500 copies. A regular release on black vinyl single was released on 6 June.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://thirdmanrecords.com/news/record-store-day-2017/|title=Record Store Day 2017|publisher=Third Man Records|access-date=28 April 2017|archive-date=27 April 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170427092050/https://thirdmanrecords.com/news/record-store-day-2017/|url-status=dead}}</ref>

Johanna and Klara sang several songs with [[Håkan Hellström]] at concerts on 9 and 10 June at [[Stockholm Olympic Stadium]], and on 28 and 29 July at [[Ullevi]] stadium in Gothenburg. On 25 August, Håkan Hellström published a live recording of "Du Fria" in digital format.<ref name="Du Fria">{{cite web|url = http://www.festivalrykten.se/hakan-hellstrom-slapper-livelat-med-silvana-imam-och-first-aid-kit/|title= Håkan Hellström släpper livelåt med Silvana Iman och First Aid Kit|publisher=Festivalrykten|access-date=25 August 2017}}</ref>

First Aid Kit resumed touring in Summer 2017, beginning with a concert on 16 June in [[Borgholm, Sweden]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://gaffa.se/recension/118611/det-enda-som-saknas-aer-publiken-fran-woodstock|title=First Aid Kit, Borgholms Slottsruin, Borgholm|publisher=Gaffa|access-date=6 December 2017|archive-date=6 December 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171206140020/http://gaffa.se/recension/118611/det-enda-som-saknas-aer-publiken-fran-woodstock|url-status=dead}}</ref> BBC broadcast their performance at Glastonbury Festival on 23 June,<ref>{{cite web|url = https://www.bbc.co.uk/events/ec584f/acts/a6hxp6|title= First Aid Kit at Glastonbury 2017|publisher=BBC|access-date=6 July 2017}}</ref> during which they performed two songs from their upcoming album [[Ruins (First Aid Kit album)|''Ruins'']]: "Fireworks" and "It's a Shame".<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.pastemagazine.com/articles/2017/09/first-aid-kit-new-single-its-a-shame.html|title=First Aid Kit Share Thoughtful New Single, "It's A Shame"|publisher=Paste Magazine|access-date=6 December 2017|archive-date=6 December 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171206135817/https://www.pastemagazine.com/articles/2017/09/first-aid-kit-new-single-its-a-shame.html|url-status=dead}}</ref>

During Fall 2017, the band gave several interviews in the UK and European media, including the German late night show ''Inas Nacht'' (''Ina's Night''), BBC Radio, Channel 4 TV news and the Channel 4 ''[[Sunday Brunch]]'' TV programme.<ref>Multiple sources:

*{{cite web|url=https://radio1.be/intieme-sessie-van-first-aid-kit|title=Intieme sessie van First Aid Kit|publisher=Radio1|access-date=5 December 2017}}</ref> Their performances of "[[Perfect Places]]" and "[[Have Yourself a Merry Little Christmas]]" were released as "Live From BBC Radio 2" singles in digital format on 18 December 2017.<ref name="BBCLive2">{{cite web|url = https://www.stereogum.com/1976165/hear-first-aid-kit-cover-lordes-perfect-places-have-yourself-a-merry-little-christmas-for-bbc-radio-2/music/|title=Hear First Aid Kit Cover Lorde's "Perfect Places" & "Have Yourself A Merry Little Christmas" For BBC Radio 2|work=Stereogum|date=18 December 2017 |access-date=18 December 2017}}</ref>

===2018–2019: ''Ruins''===
On 12 January 2018, First Aid Kit performed "It's a Shame" on BBC's ''[[Graham Norton Show]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url = https://www.bbc.co.uk/iplayer/episode/b09m6320/the-graham-norton-show-series-22-episode-13|title=The Graham Norton Show Series 22 Episode 13|work=BBC|access-date=17 January 2018}}</ref> Johanna and Klara were also interviewed on the Norwegian-Swedish TV show ''[[Skavlan]]'', where they performed "Fireworks".<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.svtplay.se/video/16581450/skavlan/skavlan-sasong-19-avsnitt-1|title=Skavlan Säsong 19 - Lars Lerin och First Aid Kit bland gästerna|work=SVT|date=12 January 2018|access-date=17 January 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180118012047/https://www.svtplay.se/video/16581450/skavlan/skavlan-sasong-19-avsnitt-1|archive-date=18 January 2018|url-status=dead}}</ref>

[[File:First Aid Kit - Palace Theatre - St. Paul, Minnesota (28224447409).jpg|thumb|Johanna, Palace Theatre - St. Paul, Minnesota, 2018]]
[[File:First Aid Kit - Palace Theatre - St. Paul, Minnesota (28224428209).jpg|thumb|Klara, Palace Theatre - St. Paul, Minnesota, 2018]]
The album [[Ruins (First Aid Kit album)|''Ruins'']] was released on 19 January 2018. The album was recorded at [[Flora Recording & Playback]] in Portland, Oregon,<ref>{{cite web|url = https://www.instagram.com/p/BPVn9C0FJ4q/|title= Portland, Oregon|publisher=First Aid Kit, Instagram|access-date=21 February 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url = http://www.lira.se/first-aid-kit-i-startgroparna/|title=First Aid Kit i startgroparna|date=23 January 2017 |publisher=Lira Musikmagasin|access-date=21 February 2017}}</ref> and contained 10 new songs.<ref name="Ruins">{{cite web|url=https://pitchfork.com/news/first-aid-kit-announce-new-album-ruins-share-new-song-postcard-listen/|title=First Aid Kit Announce New Album Ruins, Share New Song 'Postcard': Listen|work=Pitchfork|last=Wicks|first=Amanda|date=27 January 2017|access-date=28 October 2017}}</ref> The album was certified Gold in Sweden in August, and Silver in the UK in November.<ref name="sverigetopplistan.se"/><ref name="bpi"/> The release was followed by a tour throughout Canada, the US, Europe and Australia,<ref name="Columbia2017">{{cite web|url=http://www.columbiarecords.com/news/1149|title=First Aid Kit to release new album Ruins - New Song "Postcard" Out Today - Tour Dates|publisher=Columbia Records|access-date=5 December 2017|archive-date=6 December 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171206140055/http://www.columbiarecords.com/news/1149|url-status=dead}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://consequence.net/2018/05/first-aid-kit-2018-tour/|title=First Aid Kit announce North American fall tour|work=Consequence|date=8 May 2018|access-date=2 February 2022}}</ref> including performances at [[Coachella Valley Music and Arts Festival|Coachella]] on 14 and 21 April 2018.<ref>{{cite web|url = http://www.laweekly.com/music/coachella-2018-haim-first-aid-kit-9370294|title=Coachella 2018: Haim, First Aid Kit|work=laweekly.com|date=16 April 2018|access-date=22 April 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url = http://www.buzzmag.co.uk/features/being-quiet-isnt-an-option-first-aid-kit-interview/|title= "Being quiet isn't an option" – FIRST AID KIT INTERVIEW |work=buzzmag.co.uk|date=22 October 2018|access-date=15 December 2018}}</ref> During this period, they also performed on several radio and TV programs such as ''[[The Ellen DeGeneres Show]]'',<ref>{{cite web|url = https://consequence.net/2018/01/first-aid-kit-perform-its-a-shame-on-ellen-watch/|title=First Aid Kit perform "It's a Shame" on Ellen|work=Consequence|date=23 January 2018|access-date=2 February 2022}}</ref> ''[[The Andrew Marr Show]]'',<ref>{{cite web|url = https://subsaga.com/bbc/news/the-andrew-marr-show/2018/03/04.html|title=04/03/2018 The Andrew Marr Show|work=subsaga.com|access-date=14 March 2018}}</ref> ''[[Jimmy Kimmel Live!]]''<ref>{{cite web|url = https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-news/first-aid-kit-bring-angelic-harmonies-to-kimmel-with-new-song-fireworks-628614/|title=First Aid Kit Bring Angelic Harmonies to 'Kimmel' With New Song, 'Fireworks'|work=rollingstone.com|date=13 April 2018|access-date=12 October 2018}}</ref> and ''[[The Late Show with Stephen Colbert]].<ref>{{cite web|url = https://www.tvguide.com/tvshows/late-show-with-stephen-colbert/episode-200-season-3/jason-bateman-john-heilemann-alex-wagner-first-aid-kit/756671/|title= Late Show With Stephen Colbert, Season 3, Episode 200 John Heilemann & Alex Wagner; Judy Greer; First Aid Kit|work=tvguide.com|access-date=14 September 2018}}</ref>'' The songs on Ruins album are related with Klara's breakup with her boyfriend, but performing the songs on tour was hard for Johanna too as she had broken up with her boyfriend in January 2018 shortly after the album release.<ref name="WhoByFire-Independent2021">{{cite web|url = https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/music/features/first-aid-kit-interview-who-by-fire-album-b1821193.html |title=First Aid Kit: 'We're not these innocent sisters holding hands – we're angry feminist bitches |work=independent.co.uk|date=24 March 2021|accessdate=30 September 2022}}</ref>

On 11 July, [[Spotify]] released a stripped-down version of "Fireworks" and a cover of [[Kate Bush]]'s song "[[Running Up That Hill]]" as singles that were recorded in the new Spotify studio in Stockholm.<ref name="Spotify2019">{{cite web|url = https://newsroom.spotify.com/2018-07-12/the-otherworldly-magic-behind-first-aid-kits-new-spotify-singles/|title= The 'Otherworldly Magic' Behind First Aid Kit's New Spotify Singles|work=spotify.com|date=12 July 2018|access-date=13 July 2018}}</ref> On 14 September, the vinyl EP ''Tender Offerings'' was released, containing four previously unreleased tracks.<ref name="Tender Offerings EP">{{cite web|url = https://www.amazon.com/Tender-Offerings-First-Aid-Kit/dp/B07F7R8KZC|title= Tender Offerings|work=amazon.com|access-date=25 August 2018}}</ref> The EP reached number one on the UK vinyl charts.<ref>{{cite web|url = http://www.officialcharts.com/charts/vinyl-singles-chart/|title=  Official Vinyl Singles Chart Top 40, 21 September 2018 - 27 September 2018 |website= [[OfficialCharts.com]] |access-date=22 September 2018}}</ref>

First Aid Kit sang backing vocals on several 2018 releases, including [[Alela Diane]]'s song ''Ether & Wood'' from the album Cusp,<ref name="Cusp"/> [[George Ezra]]'s song "Saviour" from the album ''[[Staying at Tamara's]],''<ref name="Ezra Saviour">{{cite web|url = http://diymag.com/2018/03/13/george-ezra-first-aid-kit-saviour-staying-at-tamaras-watch|title= George Ezra recruits First Aid Kit for new track 'Saviour' |work=diymag.com|date=13 March 2018|access-date=11 October 2018}}</ref> and on [[Little Jinder]]'s song ''Goldwing'' from the album ''Hejdå''.<ref name="Jinder Goldwing">{{cite web|url = https://www.aftonbladet.se/nojesbladet/musik/a/VR8mn1/little-jinder-blandar-stark-elektronisk-haxgrogg|title= Little Jinder blandar stark elektronisk häxgrogg |work=aftonbladet.se|date=5 October 2018|access-date=11 October 2018}}</ref>

In November 2018, ''Ruins'' was nominated for International Album of the Year at the 2019 UK Americana Awards.<ref>{{cite web|url = https://www.entertainment-focus.com/music-section/ef-country/uk-americana-awards-2019-nominations-revealed/|title=  UK Americana Awards 2019 nominations revealed |work=entertainment-focus.com|date= 8 November 2018 |access-date=15 December 2018}}</ref> The band also received two Swedish Grammis award nominations in 2019, one for Song of the Year for ''"''Fireworks," and another for Alternative Pop Album of the Year for ''Ruins''.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://grammis.se/nominated_year/2019/|title=Grammis nominated 2019|work=grammis.se|access-date=15 December 2018|archive-date=17 October 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201017140433/https://grammis.se/nominated_year/2019/|url-status=dead}}</ref> In January 2019, they were again nominated for the International Group Brit Award.<ref name="Brit2019"/>

The duo's song "Home Again" appeared  on the soundtrack for the TV show [[Moominvalley]],<ref>{{cite web|url = https://www.moomin.com/en/blog/the-star-studded-lineup-for-the-moominvalley-tv-series-soundtrack-finally-revealed-tom-odell-mo-first-aid-kit-and-alma-featured/|title= The star-studded lineup for the Moominvalley TV series soundtrack finally revealed – Tom Odell, MØ, First Aid Kit and Alma featured |work=moomin.com|date=25 January 2019|access-date=27 January 2019}}</ref> which was released on 19 April.<ref name="Moominvalley">{{cite web|url = https://www.gutsy.fi/post/columbia-records-in-partnership-with-gutsy-animations-to-release-moominvalley-soundtrack |title= Columbia Records in partnership with Gutsy Animations to release Moominvalley soundtrack |work=gutsy.fi|date=22 February 2019|access-date=12 May 2019}}</ref>

On May 18 2019, the duo canceled all planned 2019 summer dates due to unforeseen medical circumstances.<ref>{{cite web|url = https://www.nme.com/news/music/first-aid-kit-cancel-summer-tour-dates-due-unforeseen-medical-circumstances-2489741 |title= First Aid Kit cancel all summer tour dates due to "unforeseen medical circumstances" |work=nme.com|date=19 May 2019|access-date=19 May 2019}}</ref> It was later revealed that the concerts were canceled because Klara was experiencing burnout.<ref name="Kristianstadsbladet2019">{{cite web|url = http://www.kristianstadsbladet.se/nyheter/first-aid-kit-kravs-mod-att-tacka-nej/ |title= First Aid Kit: "Krävs mod att tacka nej" |work=kristianstadsbladet.se|date=13 December 2019|access-date=26 December 2019}}</ref><ref name="Femina2020">{{cite web|url = https://www.femina.se/intervju/first-aid-kit-klara-om-utbrandheten-allt-kraschade-jag-kom-inte-ur-sangen/3264800 |title= First Aid Kit-Klara om utbrändheten: "Allt kraschade, jag kom inte ur sängen" |work=Femina|date=25 September 2020|access-date=24 November 2020}}</ref>

Klara wrote "Strange Beauty" after the suicide of [[David Berman (musician)|David Berman]]. The track was published on August 22, along with their cover of ''"''Random Rules" by Berman's band [[Silver Jews]].<ref name="BermanCovers">{{cite web|url = http://www.mynewsdesk.com/se/sonybmg/pressreleases/first-aid-kit-slaepper-tvaa-laatar-som-en-hyllning-till-silver-jews-nyligen-avlidne-frontman-david-berman-2908656 |title= First Aid Kit släpper två låtar som en hyllning till Silver Jews nyligen avlidne frontman David Berman |work=sonybmg|date=22 August 2019|access-date=22 August 2019}}</ref>

On 16 October 2019, the duo received the [[Ulla Billquist]] scholarship, which is awarded each year to female artists who enrich the Swedish music scene through their artistry.<ref>{{cite web|url = https://www.folketshusochparker.se/first-aid-kit-ar-2019-ars-ulla-billquist-stipendiat/ |title= First aid kit är 2019 års Ulla Billquist stipendiat |work= Folkets Hus och Parker |date=16 October 2019|access-date=17 October 2019}}</ref>

On 11 December, First Aid Kit played three songs at the Swedish TV's charity program [[Musikhjälpen]] with [[Maja Francis]].<ref>{{cite news|url = https://www.svt.se/nyheter/lokalt/vastmanland/har-hyllar-first-aid-kit-artisten-marie-fredriksson-live-i-musikhjalpen |title= Här hyllar First Aid Kit artisten Marie Fredriksson live i Musikhjälpen |newspaper= SVT Nyheter |date=11 December 2019|access-date=12 December 2019|last1=Gustavsson |first1=Robert }}</ref> First Aid Kit had Christmas-themed shows on December 17, 18 and 19 in Stockholm with [[Amanda Bergman]] and Maja Francis. <ref>{{cite web |url= https://sodrateatern.com/winter-is-blue/ |title= Winter is Blue - Julkonsert med First Aid Kit, Maja Francis och Amanda Bergman |work= Sodra Teatern |access-date= 25 October 2019 |archive-date= 25 October 2019 |archive-url= https://web.archive.org/web/20191025143916/https://sodrateatern.com/winter-is-blue/ |url-status= dead }}</ref><ref name="Kristianstadsbladet2019" /><ref>{{cite web|url = https://www.aftonbladet.se/nojesbladet/musik/a/vQpQMX/stamsangen-plogar-bort-allt-motstand |title= Stämsången plogar bort allt motstånd - Julkonserten med First Aid Kit är magisk |work=aftonbladet.se|date=18 December 2019|access-date=26 December 2019}}</ref>

===2020–2021: Streams, covers and collaborations during COVID-19 pandemic===

On 13 January 2020, Johanna announced that she is expecting a baby in the summer<ref>{{cite web|url = https://www.aftonbladet.se/nojesbladet/a/8m1ew1/first-aid-kit-sangerskan-ar-gravid |title= First aid kit-sångerskan är gravid |work=aftonbladet.se|date=13 January 2020|access-date=14 January 2020}}</ref> A baby girl was born on 18 June.<ref>{{cite web|url = https://www.aftonbladet.se/nojesbladet/a/LAJ5Kp/first-aid-kit-stjarnan-har-fatt-barn |title= First aid kit-stjärnan har fått barn |work=Aftonbladet|date=23 June 2020|access-date=23 June 2020}}</ref> On 16 January, Klara announced that she will start a country club in Stockholm with a house band.<ref>{{cite web|url = https://www.cafe.se/first-aid-kit-klara-och-sverrir-gudnason-startar-countryklubb-i-stockholm/ |title= First Aid Kit-Klara och Sverrir Gudnason startar countryklubb i Stockholm |work=cafe.se|date=16 January 2020|access-date=20 January 2020}}</ref> The first event was held on 21 February, right before the concert venues were closed due to the pandemic.<ref>{{cite news|url = https://www.dn.se/kultur-noje/lyckad-start-for-klara-soderbergs-egna-countryklubb/ |title= Lyckad start för Klara Söderbergs countryklubb |work=Dagens Nyheter|date=22 February 2020|access-date=25 February 2020}}</ref> During spring 2020 [[COVID-19 lockdowns]] the band streamed live concerts from Johanna's home.

On 14 August 2020, First Aid Kit released a cover version of [[Willie Nelson]]'s song "[[On the Road Again (Willie Nelson song)|On the Road Again]]". Proceeds from the song were donated to Crew Nation, to support crew members who were forced out of work due to [[COVID-19 pandemic]].<ref name="OnTheRoadAgain">{{cite web|url = https://www.spin.com/2020/08/first-aid-kit-willie-nelson-on-the-road-again-cover/ |title= First Aid Kit Share Cover of Willie Nelson's 'On the Road Again' |work=spin.com|date=14 August 2020|access-date=25 August 2020}}</ref> On 25 September, they released two cover versions of [[Ted Gärdestad]]'s "Come Give Me Love", one sung with the original Swedish lyrics, and the other with their own translation of the lyrics into English.<ref name="ComeGiveMeLove">{{cite web|url = https://www.thelineofbestfit.com/news/latest-news/first-aid-kit-unveil-cover-of-ted-gaerdestads-come-give-me-love |title= First Aid Kit unveil cover of Ted Gärdestad's "Come Give Me Love" |work=thelineofbestfit.com|date=25 September 2020|access-date=26 September 2020}}</ref><ref name="Femina2020"/> In 2021 the band performed on some Swedish TV-programs.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.tv4play.se/program/en-kv%C3%A4ll-f%C3%B6r-musiksverige-dont-stop-the-music|title=En kväll för musiksverige - Don't Stop the Music|work=tv4play.se|date=30 January 2021|access-date=13 February 2021|archive-date=1 February 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210201061625/https://www.tv4play.se/program/en-kv%C3%A4ll-f%C3%B6r-musiksverige-dont-stop-the-music|url-status=dead}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url = https://www.aftonbladet.se/nojesbladet/a/395lbM/en-salladskal-avgjorde-pa-sparet-semifinalen |title= En salladskål avgjorde "På spåret"-semifinalen |work=aftonbladet|date=8 February 2021|access-date=13 February 2021}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url = https://www.aftonbladet.se/nojesbladet/a/vAww05/andra-semifinalen-blev-en-rafflande-historia |title= Andra semifinalen blev en rafflande historia |work=aftonbladet|date=12 February 2021|access-date=13 February 2021}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url = https://www.nme.com/news/music/first-aid-kit-cover-bette-midlers-the-rose-on-swedish-game-show-2884987 |title= First Aid Kit cover Bette Midler's 'The Rose' on Swedish game show |work=NME|date=20 February 2021|access-date=21 February 2021}}</ref>

''Suzanne'' single from the ''Who by Fire'' live album recorded in 2017 at the [[Leonard Cohen]] tribute concert was released in February 2021 and the full album on 26 March 2021.<ref name="WhoByFire_NME"/><ref name="WhoByFire-Independent2021"/>

First Aid Kit appear as the Treetaur Shamans named Big Tree (voiced by Johanna) and Little Tree (voiced by Klara) in both the original English version and Swedish dub of Season 1 Episode 4 of the Netflix series [[Centaurworld]].<ref>{{cite web|url = https://www.playbill.com/article/centaurworld-stars-megan-hilty-jessie-mueller-and-kimiko-glenn-talk-about-shooting-mini-centaurs-from-their-hooves |title= Centaurworld Stars Megan Hilty, Jessie Mueller, and Kimiko Glenn Talk About Shooting Mini Centaurs From Their Hooves |work=playbill.com|date=2 August 2021|access-date=3 August 2021}}</ref> They reprised their roles in Season 2.

First Aid Kit appear on [[Thomas Stenström]]'s song ''"''Hotel Amigo" on his album ''Spring Baby Spring'', released on 17 September 2021;<ref>{{cite news|url = https://sverigesradio.se/artikel/thomas-stenstroms-nya-lat-en-hyllning-till-emmaboda-hotellet |title= Thomas Stenströms nya låt – en hyllning till Emmaboda-hotellet |work=sverigesradio.se|date=10 September 2021|access-date=16 September 2021|last1= Björe |first1= Rasmus |last2= Blomberg |first2= Viktor }}</ref><ref name="Springbaby">{{cite news|url = https://sverigesradio.se/artikel/recension-thomas-stenstroms-album-spring-baby-spring |title= Recension: Thomas Stenströms album Spring baby, spring |work=sverigesradio.se|date=17 September 2021|access-date=20 September 2021|last1= Rosenström |first1= Anna }}</ref> [[Maja Francis]]' song ''"''Mama" on her album ''A Pink Soft Mess'' released on 24 September 2021;<ref name="FrancisMama">{{cite web|url = https://www.orebronyheter.com/maja-francis-slapper-debutalbumet-a-pink-soft-mess/ |title= Maja Francis släpper debutalbumet "A Pink Soft Mess" |work=orebronyheter.com|date=17 September 2021|access-date=24 September 2021}}</ref> and on [[Joakim Thåström|Thåström]]'s single "Isbergen" released on 15 October 2021.<ref name="Isbergen">{{cite web|url = https://482mhz.com/2021/10/15/recension-thastrom-isbergen/ |title= Recension: Thåström – "Isbergen" |work=482mhz.com|date=15 October 2021|access-date=25 October 2021}}</ref> The duo appear on Thåström's song "Södra Korset" as well.<ref name="Södra Korset">{{cite web|url=https://gaffa.se/nyhet/152848/thastroem-intervjuas-och-spelar-i-tv-skivan-gaestas-av-first-aid-kit/|title=Thåström intervjuas och spelar i TV – skivan gästas av First Aid Kit|work=gaffa.se|date=11 November 2021|access-date=16 November 2021|archive-date=16 November 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20211116203419/https://gaffa.se/nyhet/152848/thastroem-intervjuas-och-spelar-i-tv-skivan-gaestas-av-first-aid-kit/|url-status=dead}}</ref>

===2022: ''Palomino'' and new backing band===

On 19 January 2022 First Aid Kit streamed Lion's Roar 10th anniversary concert from Mosebacke Etablissement, Stockholm with brothers Johannes and Gabriel Runemark who will be new band members.<ref>{{cite web|url = https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sVnCgz-wwlA |title= First Aid Kit - The Lion's Roar 10th Anniversary Live Stream |work=First Aid Kit|date=19 January 2022|access-date=25 June 2022}}</ref>

On 8 March 2022 Swedish TV4 aired combined cooking and music program ”Benjamin's” episode where Klara and Johanna were guests.<ref>{{cite web|url = https://nojeslivet.newsner.com/tv/first-aid-kits-arliga-ord-om-duetten-med-benjamin-efter-starka-erkannandet-i-tv4-att-vi-har/ |title= First Aid Kits ärliga ord om duetten med Benjamin Ingrosso – efter starka erkännandet i TV4 |work=Nöjeslivet|date=9 March 2022|access-date=25 June 2022}}</ref> The Swedish version of Come Give Me Love performed with [[Benjamin Ingrosso]] in the show was released as a single in various streaming services.<ref name="ComeGiveMeLove-Apple">{{cite web|url = https://music.apple.com/us/album/come-give-me-love-live-at-benjamins-single/1612644664 |title= Come Give Me Love (Live at Benjamin's) - Single |work=music.apple.com|date=8 March 2022|access-date=5 August 2022}}</ref>

First Aid Kit started touring in June 2022 and released the first single ''Angel'' from their fifth album ''[[Palomino (First Aid Kit album)|Palomino]]''.<ref name="Angel NME">{{cite web|url = https://www.nme.com/news/music/first-aid-kit-return-after-three-years-with-brand-new-single-angel-3253508 |title= First Aid Kit return after three years with brand new single 'Angel' |work=nme.com|date=22 June 2022|access-date=25 June 2022}}</ref><ref name="Palomino_Lineofbestfit">{{cite web|url = https://www.thelineofbestfit.com/news/latest-news/first-aid-kit-announce-fifth-album-palomino |title= First Aid Kit announce fifth album Palomino |work=thelineofbestfit.com|date=8 August 2022|access-date=9 August 2022}}</ref> They played [[Glastonbury]] on 24 June<ref>{{cite web|url= https://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/p0c7zw34|title= First Aid Kit Glastonbury 2022: The Swedish sisters charm the crowd with their invigorating folk music|website=BBC Music|date= 24 June 2022|accessdate=25 June 2022}}</ref> with Freja Drakenberg, Gabriel Runemark and Johannes Runemark. At the end of July they released a cover of [[Don Henley]]'s ''[[The Boys of Summer (song)|The Boys of Summer]]'' as a single in various streaming services.<ref name="BoysOfSummer-ourculture">{{cite web|url = https://ourculturemag.com/2022/07/31/first-aid-kit-cover-don-henleys-the-boys-of-summer/ |title= First Aid Kit Cover Don Henley's 'The Boys of Summer' |work=ourculturemag.com|date=31 July 2022|access-date=5 August 2022}}</ref> Second single, ''Out of My Head'' from the album was released on 12 August, the third one ''Turning Onto You'', on 30 September.<ref name="TurningOntoYou_Undertheradar">{{cite web|url = https://www.undertheradarmag.com/news/first_aid_kit_share_new_song_turning_onto_you |title= First Aid Kit Share New Song "Turning Onto You" |work=undertheradarmag.com|date=30 September 2022|access-date=1 October 2022}}</ref> and the fourth, ''A Feeling That Never Came'', on 20 October.<ref name="AFeelingThatNeverCame_Undertheradar">{{cite web|url = https://www.undertheradarmag.com/news/first_aid_kit_share_new_single_a_feeling_that_never_came |title= First Aid Kit Share New Single "A Feeling That Never Came" |work=undertheradarmag.com|date=21 October 2022|access-date=22 October 2022}}</ref> ''Palomino'' was released on 4 November 2022.<ref name="Palomino_Lineofbestfit"/><ref name="Palomino_Consequence">{{cite web|url = https://consequence.net/video/first-aid-kit-interview-palomino/ |title= First Aid Kit on Sisterhood, 10th Anniversary of Lion's Roar and the Tonal Juxtaposition of Their New Album Palomino |work=consequence.net|date=3 November 2022|access-date=4 November 2022}}</ref><ref name="Palomino_Undertheradar">{{cite web|url = https://www.undertheradarmag.com/reviews/palomino_first_aid_kit |title= Reviews First Aid Kit Palomino |work=undertheradarmag.com|date=3 November 2022|access-date=4 November 2022}}</ref> Extensive touring followed the album release.<ref>{{cite web|url = https://music.mxdwn.com/2022/11/06/news/first-aid-kit-announces-spring-summer-2023-tour-dates/ |title= First Aid Kit Announces Spring & Summer 2023 Tour Dates |work=music.mxdwn.com|date=6 November 2022|access-date=8 November 2022}}</ref> On 7 July 2023 deluxe edition of Palomino album was released with five new tracks added in streaming services and lyric video of ''Everybody's Got to Learn'' was published.<ref name="PalominoDeluxe">{{cite web|url = https://www.undertheradarmag.com/news/first_aid_kit_stream_the_deluxe_edition_of_palomino_featuring_five_new_trac |title= First Aid Kit – Stream the Deluxe Edition of "Palomino" Featuring Five New Tracks |work=undertheradarmag.com|date=7 July 2023|access-date=27 September 2023}}</ref> 

On 9 October 2023 Johanna announced that she is expecting her second baby.<ref>{{cite news|title="First aid kit"-stjärnan väntar sitt andra barn |newspaper=Aftonbladet |date=9 October 2023 |url=https://www.aftonbladet.se/nojesbladet/a/APyvK3/johanna-soderberg-fran-first-aid-kit-vantar-sitt-andra-barn|publisher=aftonbladet.se|access-date=21 October 2023}}</ref> In spite of this, First Aid Kit had a tour in Scandinavia that started on 30 October from Gothenburg.<ref>{{cite web|title=First Aid Kit åker ut på turné |work=Gaffa |date=27 September 2023 |url=https://gaffa.se/nyheter/2023/september/first-aid-kit-aker-ut-pa-turne/|publisher=gaffa.se|access-date=21 October 2023}}</ref> A baby girl was born on 26 March 2024. The next live performances will be in Stockholm with Swedish Radio Symphony Orchestra on 30 January, 31 January and 1 February 2025.<ref>{{cite web|title=First Aid Kit meets the Swedish Radio Symphony Orchestra |work=berwaldhallen.se |url=https://www.berwaldhallen.se/en/concert/first-aid-kit-meets-the-swedish-radio-symphony-orchestra/|access-date=29 May 2024}}</ref>

On 12 January 2023 First Aid Kit was nominated third time for the International Group of the Year Brit award.<ref name="Brit2023"/> On 3 May 2023 First Aid Kit won Swedish Grammis award for Palomino in the 2023 alternative pop category.<ref>{{cite web|url = https://www.tv4play.se/klipp/3addc91c9c80184553fc?first=13343771 |title= First Aid Kit vinner pris för "Årets alternativa pop" på Grammisgalan 2023 |work=tv4pay.se|date=3 May 2023|access-date=27 September 2023}}</ref>

First Aid Kit appear on [[Tove Lo]]'s song ''Cute & Cruel'' on her 14 October 2022 released album ''[[Dirt Femme]]'',<ref name="Cute&Cruel">{{cite web|url = https://pitchfork.com/reviews/albums/tove-lo-dirt-femme/ |title= ALBUMS Dirt Femme Tove Lo 2022 |work=Pitchfork|date=31 October 2022|access-date=17 February 2023}}</ref> on [[Pink (singer)|Pink]]'s song ''Kids in Love'' on her 17 February 2023 released album ''[[Trustfall]]'',<ref name="KidsInLove">{{cite web|url = https://www.irishexaminer.com/lifestyle/artsandculture/arid-41073101.html |title= Album review: Pink enlists the help of First Aid Kit and Max Martin |work=Irish Examiner|date=17 February 2023|access-date=17 February 2023}}</ref> on [[M. Ward]]'s songs ''Too Young To Die'' and ''Engine 5'' on his ''Supernatural Thing'' album that was released on June 23<ref name="SupernaturalThing">{{cite web|url = https://www.stereoboard.com/content/view/239385/9 |title= M. Ward Announces New Album 'Supernatural Thing', Shares Title Track |work=stereoboard.com|date=28 April 2023|access-date=3 May 2023}}</ref> and on [[Lola Kirke]]'s song ''All My Exes Live in L.A.'' that will be on her 16 February 2024 released EP ''Country Curious''.<ref name="Exes_LolaKirke">{{cite web|url = https://www.msn.com/en-us/music/news/lola-kirke-ditches-her-former-flames-and-clothes-in-revealing-video-for-all-my-exes-live-in-la/ar-AA1fApaQ |title= Lola Kirke Ditches Her Former Flames (and Clothes) in Revealing Video for 'All My Exes Live in L.A.' |work=msn.com|date=22 August 2023|access-date=27 September 2023}}</ref>

==Band members==

===Line-up===
*Klara Söderberg – vocals, guitar, keyboards (2007–present)
*Johanna Söderberg – vocals, bass guitar, keyboards, autoharp (2007–present)
*Freja "Freja the Dragon" Drakenberg – keyboards (2022–present)
*Scott Simpson – drums (2015–2019 and occasionally to present. He is also the band's long time tour manager)
*Gabriel Runemark - drums (2022–present)
*Johannes Runemark (a.k.a. Kasino) – guitar and mandolin (2022–present)

===Previous members===
*Mattias Bergqvist – drums (2009–2012)
*Niclas Lindström – drums (2012–2014)
*Melvin Duffy – pedal steel guitar, mandolin and electric guitar (2013–2019)<ref>{{cite web|url = http://www.theadvocate.com/baton_rouge/entertainment_life/article_92ddfb78-eea4-5eee-88cc-a76ea0a2dcfa.html|title=Swedish sisters bring sweet harmony to House of Blues|work=.theadvocate.com|date=15 November 2014|access-date=21 March 2018}}</ref>
*Steve Moore – keyboards, trombone (2017–2019)
